page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY NOTES.
page.content: selling bits of skeletons to eager anatomists,and burial relics to anyone who would pay for them.But a number of urns,brooches,beads,buckles,knives and spearheads from the site have found their way into various museums. The church was consecrated in 1352. There had been an older church building on the site since the 12th century,parts of which form the present chancel walls,and the consecration date presumably marked the extensive reconstruction of the 14th century which gave us the present building,except for the fine tower which was added fifty years later.The local clunch,which was mainly used for the work,is not a very durable material,and much restoration has since been needed.The Wendy family, Lords of the Manor in the 16th and 17th centuries,did a considerable
